info.title: CDN Pro API Specification
info.description: CDN Pro APIs allow you to manage the CDN Pro service.

get.description: Get the detailed configuration of a property version.

200.description: The response contains the full details of the property version configuration.

schema.title: propertyVersion
schema.description: This describes a property version. It includes all of the configuration along with information about its deployment status.

configs.title: propertyConfiguration
configs.description: Describes a property configuration. This contains all the settings.

description.description: A description of the version.

cacheKeyHostname.description: The cachekey hostname must be a string made of lowercase letters, digits, dot, dash, and underscore. If not specified, the incoming Host header value will be used and the cache will not be shared across different hostnames in this property.

hostnames.description: Hostnames associated with the property. A valid value is a fully qualified hostname such as www.domain.com or a wildcard hostname such as *.domain.com. Any given hostname can only be in one deployed property at a particular time. However, a wildcard hostname is permitted to overlap other hostnames you own.

realTimeLog.description: This optional field allows you to configure notifications about client requests to be sent to a remote server. It can be used only if you have access to our realtime_log_switch directive. Please contact our support team if you require this feature.

logUrl.description: The URL that receives the notifications. It must begin with “http” or "https". The server should support the POST method. This is a required field.

sampleRate.description: An integer between [1, 65536]. n means one notification for every n edge requests. 1 means every edge request will generate a notification. This is optional. Default is 1.

escape.description: Specify json to enable JSON character escaping in variables, compactJson to enable JSON character escaping with whitespace in the body removed, or none to disable escaping.

format.description:
This is a required field to specify the notification body to be sent to the remote server. It can be any printable text that can be sent in the body of an HTTP POST request. The following built-in variables can be used within the format field. They will be replaced with the actual values in the notifications.
NameDescription
$body_bytes_sentSize of the response body.
$bytes_sentSize of the response, including body, headers and response line.
$client_country_codeAn ISO 3166-1 country code representing the country of the client request, for example, "US". "ZZ" is returned if the country is unknown.
$client_real_ipIP address of the client request.
$cookie_xThis lets you obtain any cookie named x. For example, $cookie_account would retrieve the value of a cookie named 'account'.
$http_xObtain any HTTP header named x from the original request. The header name is converted to lower case with dashes replaced by underscores. For example, specify $http_user_agent to get the value of User-Agent.
$msecCurrent unix time in seconds with millisecond precision.
$qtl_req_idUnique identifier representing the request.
$request_uriHTTP request URI
$request_methodThe HTTP request method used to access the origin.
$request_timeResponse time in milliseconds. It is the time between receiving the request's first byte and serving the last byte of the response.
$sc_completed1 to indicate the last byte of the object was served to the user, 0 otherwise.
$sc_initial1 to indicate the first byte of the object was served to the user, 0 otherwise.
$schemeIndicates the protocol of the user's request ("http" or https").
$sent_http_content_lengththe original file size.
$sent_http_xObtain the value of an HTTP header named x that is returned in the response to the client. The header name should be converted to lower case with dashes replaced by underscores. For example, $sent_http_etag would give you the value of the ETag header.
$server_addrIP address of the edge node serving the user's request.
$server_protocolIndicates the version of HTTP used in the user's request, either "HTTP/1.0", "HTTP/1.1", or "HTTP/2.0".
$ssl_cipherIndicates the cipher suite used for the TLS (SSL) connection.
$ssl_server_nameThe hostname that a client initiating a TLS (SSL) connection is attempting to connect to. It is only sent by clients supporting SNI (Server Name Indication).
$ssl_protocolIndicates the TLS version used for the TLS (SSL) connection. Example versions include "SSLv3", "TLSv1", "TLSv1.1", "TLSv1.2", and "unknown".
$statusAn HTTP response code for the user's request.
$tcpinfo_rttThe time in microseconds taken by a packet to travel to the destination and back.

headers.description: HTTP header names and values to be sent to the notification server. A header name can contain any alphanumeric character or hyphen, "-". A header value can contain any printable characters. It can also include any of the built-in variables supported in the format field of the realTimeLog object.

hasBeian.description: The value indicates whether all the hostnames in this property have Beian license on file with the Chinese government. This is required to serve this property from servers in mainland China. A value of false means servers outside of mainland China will be used to distribute content to visitors in China. If set to true you must also specify the content type in the beianContentType field.

redirectHttpToHttps.description: This field can be set to either a boolean value or a string. If the value is set to true, the server will redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS using status code 301. You can also specify string values "302", "307", or "308" instead if you wish to return a different status code when a request is redirected.

origins.description: Describes the origin servers for the property's content.

items.description: Describes an origin server.

name.description: Name of an origin. It must be unique within this property.

servers.description:
Each entry should be a string consisting of an address optionally followed by one or more parameters, separated by space characters. The address can take one of the following three forms:
  • {hostname or IP address}
  • {hostname or IP address}:{http port}
  • {hostname or IP address}:{http port},{https port}
The IP address can be either IPv4 or IPv6. IPv6 is supported if the property's enableIpv6Origin setting is true. IPv6 addresses can be specified in uncompressed or compressed format, for example, 2001:1234:0000:0000:1b12:0000:0000:1a13 or 2001:1234::1b12:0:0:1a13. Values for the HTTP and HTTPS ports should be integers in the range [1,65535]. Even if the value of supportedProtocol is “https”, the HTTPS port must be specified after the comma. In the third form, one of the two ports can be empty. Supported parameters are "backup" and "weight". "backup" is used to indicate the server is a backup server. It will be used when the primary servers are unavailable. "weight" is a value in the range [1, 100]. The default value is 1. It lets you control the likelihood that one origin server will be used relative to another. There should be at least one primary server defined; it does not have the "backup" parameter. Example: ["www.abc.com weight=1", "www1.abc.com:8080 weight=4", "www2.abc.com:880,4443 backup"] This example specifies two primary servers which are used in a 1:4 ratio meaning one gets about 20% of the requests to origin while the other gets 80% of the requests. In addition, a backup server is specified.

supportedProtocol.description: This optional field indicates the protocol supported by the origin server. If this property has a certificate attached to it, the value can be set to http if the allowProtocolDowngrade field is also set to true.

directConnection.description:
Optional. This parameter tells us how important it is to directly go to this origin without going through any intermediate cache to fetch content. The values can be “noDirect”, “auto”, “alwaysDirect”. 

“noDirect” means we always go through at least one intermediate cache. Customers who care particularly about the origin's workload can use this option. Our cache scheduler will dynamically pick the intermediate cache based on performance and resource availability.

“auto” means the cache scheduler will make the choice dynamically based on performance and resource availability. This is the default behavior if not specified.

“alwaysDirect” means we always directly connect to this origin.

hostHeader.description: Optional. It should be a valid hostname. It will also be used as the SNI servername when contacting the HTTPS origin. We also allow it to be an nginx variable that begins with ‘$’ followed by [a-z_]{3,60}. Nginx variable names are case insensitive, so we only allow lowercase characters. If not specified, the value of the HOST header in the request will be used. One constraint is that if “awsS3” is specified for origin authentication, the value of hostHeader cannot be a variable or empty. It has to be a valid Amazon S3 or S3-compatible hostname. Refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/VirtualHosting.html

verifyOrigin.description: Optional. It controls whether the cache will validate the certificate of the origin.

authentication.description:
Optional. It is a structure to specify the parameters, such as password, for authentication with the origin servers. It should have at least one field: ”methodName”, which should be a string indicating one of the predefined authentication methods. The only valid value at this time is “awsS3”. When “awsS3” is used, the following parameters are required:
  • awsS3.region
  • awsS3.accessKey
  • awsS3.secretKey
Also, the value of the hostHeader field cannot be a variable or empty. It must be a valid Amazon S3 or S3-compatible hostname. Example: {"methodName":"awsS3", "awsS3":{ "region":"us-west-1", "accessKey":"sdnu2932", "secretKey":"d12345678abcdefghi" }}

keepAliveTimeout.description: Timeout in seconds during which an idle keepalive connection to an upstream server will stay open. A service quota setting of maxUpstreamKeepaliveTimeOut can change the maximum permitted value.

peerFailureTimeout.description: This setting allows you to specify the number of unsuccessful attempts to reach one of the origin's IP addresses or peers before it is marked as unavailable for a period of time designated by the timeout. The number of attempts should be specified in a subfield of the peerFailureTimeout object called failureThreshold while the timeout in seconds should be in a subfield called timeout. If all peers of all servers are unavailable, requests for content from the origin will receive an immediate 502 HTTP response. By default, six attempts to a peer are made, after which a one-second timeout applies to that peer. To disable this feature, set peerFailureTimeout to "off".

failureThreshold.description: Number of attempts to connect to a peer before it is considered unavailable.

tlsCertificateId.description: Refers to a certificate used to authenticate with the origin server. This certificate must also be deployed.

shield.description: Refers to the ID of an origin shield representing a set of servers that will make requests to your origin servers rather than the CDN Pro edge servers. This can help further reduce traffic to your origin. This is an advanced feature that can be enabled by contacting our support team. The origin shields API provides a list of available shields along with their IP addresses. It is best if you select a shield whose region is closest to your origin servers. Use of a shield in China requires your property have 'hasBeian' set to true. If your origin servers have an access control list, add the IPs of the shield you choose to use.

maxConnections.description: Defines the maximum number of simultaneous connections to the origin. The default is '0', which indicates connections are unlimited.

peerSelectionAlgorithm.description:
This setting controls how the origin server is selected when an origin server's hostname resolves to multiple IP addresses.
round_robin Rotate among the peers sequentially. This is the default setting, which tries to evenly distribute the origin traffic to all the peers.
consistent_hashDistribute the origin traffic based on the hash value of the URL. If the origin server has a cache, this option should help with the hit ratio.
sorted_listSelect the peer based on the network quality. When the origin peers are geographically distributed (such as another CDN), this option should help ensure consistent performance.

syntaxVersion.description: The value must be set to 1 at this time.

disableHttp2.description: Set to true to disable support for HTTP/2 and support only HTTP 1.1. HTTP/2 requires TLS to work, so you must specify a certificate in the tlsCertificateId field to support HTTP/2.

schemeInCacheKey.description: Specifies whether the scheme (“http” or “https”) should be included in the cache key. Default behavior is false. Set to true if the content is known to be different for different schemes.

tlsMaxVersion.description: Maximum supported TLS version. TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1 have been deprecated for security reasons, so we strongly recommend a minimum of TLS 1.2.

loadBalancerHashKey.description:
Multiple tiers of load balancing are used in our CDN pops to distribute the client requests to different servers. We are using consistent hashing in many of those places. By default, the URL is used as the hash key, which should be good enough in most cases. Here you can define additional variables to be added to the hash key to distribute the requests more evenly. One typical use case is when all requests carry the same URL, but use a particular header to indicate the resources. This is an optional field. The default value is an empty string. A valid value is a string meeting the following criteria:
  1. Consists of alphanumeric characters, underscore _, equal sign =, dollar sign $, and ampersand sign &.
  2. The variable names can only be in one of the following formats: $http_name, $cookie_name, or $arg_name.
  3. At least one variable must be specified. No more than three are permitted.
  4. The total length should be no more than 100 characters.
The validator will treat any dollar sign and the string after it (before any = or & or $) as a variable. Here are some examples of valid values:
$http_abc
abc=$http_abc&def=$http_def&c_123=$cookie_123
abc=$http_abc=$http_def
$http_abc&$http_def
=$http_abd&
&&abc==$http_abc&&&===qwer

tlsCertificateId.description: Refers to a certificate. It is invalid to set only the tlsCertificateId1 field without setting the tlsCertificateId field. If tlsCertificateId is not set, HTTPS will not be enabled for this property. This is a feature to enable you to specify two certificates of different types, i.e. one RSA, one EC. If two certificates of the same type are specified, the one specified by tlsCertificateId will be ignored.

tlsMinVersion.description: Minimum required TLS version. TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1 have been deprecated for security reasons, so we strongly recommend a minimum of TLS 1.2.

tlsCiphers.description: Any cipher list supported by "openssl ciphers". See https://www.openssl.org/docs/manmaster/man1/ciphers.html

allowProtocolDowngrade.description: This setting applies only if the property has an attached certificate allowing client requests to use HTTPS. If the value of allowProtocolDowngrade is false, we require all the origin servers to support HTTPS. If the value is true, we allow origins that support only HTTP, which reduces security.

tlsCertificateId1.description: Refers to a certificate. It is invalid to set only the tlsCertificateId1 field without setting the tlsCertificateId field. If tlsCertificateId is not set, HTTPS will not be enabled for this property. This is a feature to enable you to specify two certificates of different types, i.e. one RSA, one EC. If two certificates of the same type are specified, the one specified by tlsCertificateId will be ignored.

videoSeek.description: This object allows you to support video players requesting partial content through query string parameters. If you specify videoSeek, you must enter a value for startParameter.

startParameter.description: Name of the query parameter indicating the starting offset in bytes of the content to fetch. The parameter name should begin with a letter (a-z, A-Z) and may be followed by up to 30 letters and numbers.

endParameter.description: Name of the query parameter indicating the ending offset of the content to fetch. The parameter name should begin with a letter (a-z, A-Z) and may be followed by up to 30 letters and numbers.

tlsSessionTimeout.description: Lifespan of TLS session ticket in seconds.

enableOcspStapling.description: Enables Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) stapling to check the revocation status of digital certificates. (Refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OCSP_stapling)

beianContentType.description:
If you are planning to distribute content through servers in mainland China, you will need to set the hasBeian field to true and also indicate the type of content you are distributing. Enter the value that best corresponds to your content:
ValueContent Type
1Instant Messaging
2Search Engine
3Web Portal
4Online Postal Service
5Online News
6Blog
7Advertisement
8Organization Web Portal
9Shopping
10Online Payment
11Online Bank
12Online Stock Market
13Online Gaming
14Online Music
15Online Movie
16Online Picture
17Software Download
18Job Hunting
19Online Dating
20Online Real Property
21Online Education
22Web Design
23WAP
24Others

accessControlRules.description: Specify one or more access control rules to restrict access to your content. More advanced configuration can be done using Edge Logic. These access control rules take precedence over Edge Logic if both are defined.

items.title: accessControlRule
items.description: This object defines a rule that can be used to restrict access to your content. More complex rules can be created using CDN Pro's Edge Logic.

id.description: An optional ID for the access control rule.

conditions.description: Specify the conditions that the incoming request must match. At least one condition must be specified. If multiple are specified, all must match.

scheme.description: Indicates whether the incoming request uses HTTP or HTTPS.

hostname.description: Indicates the hostname requested. It must be one of the hostnames defined in the property.

uri.description: The URI begins with "/" and can end with "*" for prefix matching.

serverRegions.description: An array of ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 codes indicating the countries of the servers, for example, "US" to represent "United States of America".

clientRegions.description: An array of ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 codes indicating one or more countries which are the source of the client requests, for example, "CN" to represent "China".

clientIpRange.description: Indicates the starting and ending IP addresses of the client requests to match against. They must be in IPv4 or IPv6 format.

action.description: Indicates the action to take in response to a request that matches the conditions of the access control rule.

statusCode.description: Indicates the HTTP status code to respond with. It must be in the range 300-309, 400-409, or 500-509 to indicate a redirection or error.

message.description: If the value of the status field is in the range 300-309, the message field's value will be placed in a Location HTTP header returned to the client. If the status is in the range 400-409 or 500-509, the value will be returned in the response body to the client.

disableCertAutomation.description: By default, CDN Pro takes control of the contents under the /.well-known/{acme-challenge, pki-validation} directories to support certificate auto-renew for properties. If for any reason you need to manage these two directories by yourself on the origin, for example, to implement your own certificate auto-renew mechanism, you can use this configuration option to disable the default behavior by setting its value to true. For more information about our support for certificate auto-renewal, refer to the description of the autoRenew field in the Create a certificate API.

cacheKeyUri.description: This setting controls how the URI of the incoming request is incorporated into the cache key if you use a "rewrite" directive in the property's Edge Logic. The default value, "preRewrite", puts the unmodified URI into the cache key while "postRewrite" uses the modified URI. If your rewrite directive converts multiple different URIs into the same value, using "postRewrite" may result in a higher cache hit ratio.

extraServicePorts.description: This field lists ports other than the default 80 used to handle HTTP requests and ports other than the default 443 used to handle HTTPS requests.

http.description: This is a list of ports other than 80 which are used to handle HTTP requests. The available values can be found in the systemConfigs API's response. If you need another port, please contact our support team.

https.description: This is a list of ports other than 443 which are used to handle HTTPS requests. The available values can be found in the systemConfigs API's response. If you need another port, please contact our support team.

tls0Rtt.description: Enable TLS zero round-trip time, a feature of TLS 1.3 that can improve performance for repeat visits to a site. If enabling it though, be sure your site is not vulnerable to the HTTP replay attack.

enableIpv6Origin.description: Enable use of IPv6 addresses to access the property's origin servers.

followClientIpVersion.description:
When enableIpv6Origin is enabled, this setting controls whether to match the addressing method used by a client if a request to the origin is required to fetch content.
ValueBehavior
autoAttempt to reach the origin server using the same IP addressing as the client, but use the other version as backup if needed.
strictUse only the same addressing method as the client when accessing the origin for content.
offUse both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing to reach the origin, regardless of the IP addressing method used by the client.

enableHttp3.description: Set to true to enable support for HTTP/3. HTTP/3 requires TLS to work, so this field will be ignored unless you specify a certificate in the tlsCertificateId field.

warning.description: This field can appear if the property is created or updated with a reference to a certificate that is incompatible. For example, the certificate could be expired or does not support the property's hostname. The value will provide details.

400.description: The request was invalid. Refer to the response body for details.

value.message: The version number must be a positive integer or "latest".

404.description: Invalid property.

value.message: The specified property ID does not exist.

parameters.name: On-Behalf-Of
parameters.description: If you are a reseller, you can use this header to specify the ID of a child customer.

parameters.name: propertyID
parameters.description: ID of a property.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: A property version. It must be an integer value >=1. The Get a property version API also permits you to specify the word 'latest' to obtain the most recent version.

204.description: Indicates the property version was successfully updated.

Warning.description: This header will appear if the property refers to a certificate that is expired or does not support the property's hostname. Call Get a property version API for details.

400.description: The request was invalid. Refer to the response body for details.

value.message: The property version cannot be updated because it is currently deployed to staging or production.
The version number must be a positive integer.
The allowed values for redirectHttpToHttps are true, false, 302, 307 and 308.
At least one of the hostnames is equal to an origin's server name.
Invalid field 'nonexistentfield'.
The algorithm type of the two certificates must be different. The current certificate algorithm type is 'RSA'.
Invalid hostname(s): "ghjhkj参考.domain.com".
A shield is acceptable only when "directConnection" is set to "noDirect".

404.description: The property could not be found.

value.message: The specified property ID does not exist.

patch.description: This API lets you update a property version. Please note that a property that has already been deployed to production or staging is 'frozen' and cannot be updated or validated again. The only exception is that the version description can be updated. If a property is frozen, you should create a new property version instead.

schema.title: propertyConfiguration
schema.description: Describes a property configuration. This contains all the settings.

description.description: A description of the version.

cacheKeyHostname.description: The cachekey hostname must be a string made of lowercase letters, digits, dot, dash, and underscore. If not specified, the incoming Host header value will be used and the cache will not be shared across different hostnames in this property.

hostnames.description: Hostnames associated with the property. A valid value is a fully qualified hostname such as www.domain.com or a wildcard hostname such as *.domain.com. Any given hostname can only be in one deployed property at a particular time. However, a wildcard hostname is permitted to overlap other hostnames you own.

realTimeLog.description: This optional field allows you to configure notifications about client requests to be sent to a remote server. It can be used only if you have access to our realtime_log_switch directive. Please contact our support team if you require this feature.

logUrl.description: The URL that receives the notifications. It must begin with “http” or "https". The server should support the POST method. This is a required field.

This is a required field to specify the notification body to be sent to the remote server. It can be any printable text that can be sent in the body of an HTTP POST request. The following built-in variables can be used within the format field. They will be replaced with the actual values in the notifications.
NameDescription
$body_bytes_sentSize of the response body.
$bytes_sentSize of the response, including body, headers and response line.
$client_country_codeAn ISO 3166-1 country code representing the country of the client request, for example, "US". "ZZ" is returned if the country is unknown.

$http_xObtain any HTTP header named x from the original request. The header name is converted to lower case with dashes replaced by underscores. For example, specify $http_user_agent to get the value of User-Agent.
$msecCurrent unix time in seconds with millisecond precision.
$qtl_req_idUnique identifier representing the request.

$request_timeResponse time in milliseconds. It is the time between receiving the request's first byte and serving the last byte of the response.
$sc_completed1 to indicate the last byte of the object was served to the user, 0 otherwise.
$sc_initial1 to indicate the first byte of the object was served to the user, 0 otherwise.

$sent_http_xObtain the value of an HTTP header named x that is returned in the response to the client. The header name should be converted to lower case with dashes replaced by underscores. For example, $sent_http_etag would give you the value of the ETag header.

$ssl_cipherIndicates the cipher suite used for the TLS (SSL) connection.
$ssl_server_nameThe hostname that a client initiating a TLS (SSL) connection is attempting to connect to. It is only sent by clients supporting SNI (Server Name Indication).
$ssl_protocolIndicates the TLS version used for the TLS (SSL) connection. Example versions include "SSLv3", "TLSv1", "TLSv1.1", "TLSv1.2", and "unknown".
$statusAn HTTP response code for the user's request.
$tcpinfo_rttThe time in microseconds taken by a packet to travel to the destination and back.

headers.description: HTTP header names and values to be sent to the notification server. A header name can contain any alphanumeric character or hyphen, "-". A header value can contain any printable characters. It can also include any of the built-in variables supported in the format field of the realTimeLog object.

hasBeian.description: The value indicates whether all the hostnames in this property have Beian license on file with the Chinese government. This is required to serve this property from servers in mainland China. A value of false means servers outside of mainland China will be used to distribute content to visitors in China. If set to true you must also specify the content type in the beianContentType field.

redirectHttpToHttps.description: This field can be set to either a boolean value or a string. If the value is set to true, the server will redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS using status code 301. You can also specify string values "302", "307", or "308" instead if you wish to return a different status code when a request is redirected.

items.description: Describes an origin server.

  • {hostname or IP address}:{http port}
  • {hostname or IP address}:{http port},{https port}
The IP address can be either IPv4 or IPv6. IPv6 is supported if the property's enableIpv6Origin setting is true. IPv6 addresses can be specified in uncompressed or compressed format, for example, 2001:1234:0000:0000:1b12:0000:0000:1a13 or 2001:1234::1b12:0:0:1a13. Values for the HTTP and HTTPS ports should be integers in the range [1,65535]. Even if the value of supportedProtocol is “https”, the HTTPS port must be specified after the comma. In the third form, one of the two ports can be empty. Supported parameters are "backup" and "weight". "backup" is used to indicate the server is a backup server. It will be used when the primary servers are unavailable. "weight" is a value in the range [1, 100]. The default value is 1. It lets you control the likelihood that one origin server will be used relative to another. There should be at least one primary server defined; it does not have the "backup" parameter. Example: ["www.abc.com weight=1", "www1.abc.com:8080 weight=4", "www2.abc.com:880,4443 backup"] This example specifies two primary servers which are used in a 1:4 ratio meaning one gets about 20% of the requests to origin while the other gets 80% of the requests. In addition, a backup server is specified.

Optional. This parameter tells us how important it is to directly go to this origin without going through any intermediate cache to fetch content. The values can be “noDirect”, “auto”, “alwaysDirect”. 

“noDirect” means we always go through at least one intermediate cache. Customers who care particularly about the origin's workload can use this option. Our cache scheduler will dynamically pick the intermediate cache based on performance and resource availability.

“auto” means the cache scheduler will make the choice dynamically based on performance and resource availability. This is the default behavior if not specified.

“alwaysDirect” means we always directly connect to this origin.

We also allow it to be an nginx variable that begins with ‘$’ followed by [a-z_]{3,60}. Nginx variable names are case insensitive, so we only allow lowercase characters. If not specified, the value of the HOST header in the request will be used. One constraint is that if “awsS3” is specified for origin authentication, the value of hostHeader cannot be a variable or empty. It has to be a valid Amazon S3 or S3-compatible hostname. Refer to https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/VirtualHosting.html

Optional. It is a structure to specify the parameters, such as password, for authentication with the origin servers. It should have at least one field: ”methodName”, which should be a string indicating one of the predefined authentication methods. The only valid value at this time is “awsS3”. When “awsS3” is used, the following parameters are required:
  • awsS3.region
  • awsS3.accessKey
  • awsS3.secretKey
Also, the value of the hostHeader field cannot be a variable or empty. It must be a valid Amazon S3 or S3-compatible hostname. Example: {"methodName":"awsS3", "awsS3":{ "region":"us-west-1", "accessKey":"sdnu2932", "secretKey":"d12345678abcdefghi" }}

keepAliveTimeout.description: Timeout in seconds during which an idle keepalive connection to an upstream server will stay open. A service quota setting of maxUpstreamKeepaliveTimeOut can change the maximum permitted value.

peerFailureTimeout.description: This setting allows you to specify the number of unsuccessful attempts to reach one of the origin's IP addresses or peers before it is marked as unavailable for a period of time designated by the timeout. The number of attempts should be specified in a subfield of the peerFailureTimeout object called failureThreshold while the timeout in seconds should be in a subfield called timeout. If all peers of all servers are unavailable, requests for content from the origin will receive an immediate 502 HTTP response. By default, six attempts to a peer are made, after which a one-second timeout applies to that peer. To disable this feature, set peerFailureTimeout to "off".

failureThreshold.description: Number of attempts to connect to a peer before it is considered unavailable.

tlsCertificateId.description: Refers to a certificate used to authenticate with the origin server. This certificate must also be deployed.

shield.description: Refers to the ID of an origin shield representing a set of servers that will make requests to your origin servers rather than the CDN Pro edge servers. This can help further reduce traffic to your origin. This is an advanced feature that can be enabled by contacting our support team. The origin shields API provides a list of available shields along with their IP addresses. It is best if you select a shield whose region is closest to your origin servers. Use of a shield in China requires your property have 'hasBeian' set to true. If your origin servers have an access control list, add the IPs of the shield you choose to use.

maxConnections.description: Defines the maximum number of simultaneous connections to the origin. The default is '0', which indicates connections are unlimited.

peerSelectionAlgorithm.description:
This setting controls how the origin server is selected when an origin server's hostname resolves to multiple IP addresses.
round_robin Rotate among the peers sequentially. This is the default setting, which tries to evenly distribute the origin traffic to all the peers.
consistent_hashDistribute the origin traffic based on the hash value of the URL. If the origin server has a cache, this option should help with the hit ratio.
sorted_listSelect the peer based on the network quality. When the origin peers are geographically distributed (such as another CDN), this option should help ensure consistent performance.

syntaxVersion.description: The value must be set to 1 at this time.

disableHttp2.description: Set to true to disable support for HTTP/2 and support only HTTP 1.1. HTTP/2 requires TLS to work, so you must specify a certificate in the tlsCertificateId field to support HTTP/2.

schemeInCacheKey.description: Specifies whether the scheme (“http” or “https”) should be included in the cache key. Default behavior is false. Set to true if the content is known to be different for different schemes.

tlsMaxVersion.description: Maximum supported TLS version. TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1 have been deprecated for security reasons, so we strongly recommend a minimum of TLS 1.2.

loadBalancerHashKey.description:
Multiple tiers of load balancing are used in our CDN pops to distribute the client requests to different servers. We are using consistent hashing in many of those places. By default, the URL is used as the hash key, which should be good enough in most cases. Here you can define additional variables to be added to the hash key to distribute the requests more evenly. One typical use case is when all requests carry the same URL, but use a particular header to indicate the resources. This is an optional field. The default value is an empty string. A valid value is a string meeting the following criteria:
  1. Consists of alphanumeric characters, underscore _, equal sign =, dollar sign $, and ampersand sign &.
  2. The variable names can only be in one of the following formats: $http_name, $cookie_name, or $arg_name.
  3. At least one variable must be specified. No more than three are permitted.
  4. The total length should be no more than 100 characters.
The validator will treat any dollar sign and the string after it (before any = or & or $) as a variable. Here are some examples of valid values:
$http_abc
abc=$http_abc&def=$http_def&c_123=$cookie_123
abc=$http_abc=$http_def
$http_abc&$http_def
=$http_abd&
&&abc==$http_abc&&&===qwer

tlsCertificateId.description: Refers to a certificate. It is invalid to set only the tlsCertificateId1 field without setting the tlsCertificateId field. If tlsCertificateId is not set, HTTPS will not be enabled for this property. This is a feature to enable you to specify two certificates of different types, i.e. one RSA, one EC. If two certificates of the same type are specified, the one specified by tlsCertificateId will be ignored.

tlsMinVersion.description: Minimum required TLS version. TLS versions 1.0 and 1.1 have been deprecated for security reasons, so we strongly recommend a minimum of TLS 1.2.

tlsCiphers.description: Any cipher list supported by "openssl ciphers". See https://www.openssl.org/docs/manmaster/man1/ciphers.html

allowProtocolDowngrade.description: This setting applies only if the property has an attached certificate allowing client requests to use HTTPS. If the value of allowProtocolDowngrade is false, we require all the origin servers to support HTTPS. If the value is true, we allow origins that support only HTTP, which reduces security.

tlsCertificateId1.description: Refers to a certificate. It is invalid to set only the tlsCertificateId1 field without setting the tlsCertificateId field. If tlsCertificateId is not set, HTTPS will not be enabled for this property. This is a feature to enable you to specify two certificates of different types, i.e. one RSA, one EC. If two certificates of the same type are specified, the one specified by tlsCertificateId will be ignored.

videoSeek.description: This object allows you to support video players requesting partial content through query string parameters. If you specify videoSeek, you must enter a value for startParameter.

startParameter.description: Name of the query parameter indicating the starting offset in bytes of the content to fetch. The parameter name should begin with a letter (a-z, A-Z) and may be followed by up to 30 letters and numbers.

endParameter.description: Name of the query parameter indicating the ending offset of the content to fetch. The parameter name should begin with a letter (a-z, A-Z) and may be followed by up to 30 letters and numbers.

tlsSessionTimeout.description: Lifespan of TLS session ticket in seconds.

enableOcspStapling.description: Enables Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) stapling to check the revocation status of digital certificates. (Refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OCSP_stapling)

beianContentType.description:
If you are planning to distribute content through servers in mainland China, you will need to set the hasBeian field to true and also indicate the type of content you are distributing. Enter the value that best corresponds to your content:
ValueContent Type
1Instant Messaging
2Search Engine
3Web Portal
4Online Postal Service
5Online News
6Blog
7Advertisement
8Organization Web Portal
9Shopping
10Online Payment
11Online Bank
12Online Stock Market
13Online Gaming
14Online Music
15Online Movie
16Online Picture
17Software Download
18Job Hunting
19Online Dating
20Online Real Property
21Online Education
22Web Design
23WAP
24Others

accessControlRules.description: Specify one or more access control rules to restrict access to your content. More advanced configuration can be done using Edge Logic. These access control rules take precedence over Edge Logic if both are defined.

items.title: accessControlRule
items.description: This object defines a rule that can be used to restrict access to your content. More complex rules can be created using CDN Pro's Edge Logic.

id.description: An optional ID for the access control rule.

conditions.description: Specify the conditions that the incoming request must match. At least one condition must be specified. If multiple are specified, all must match.

scheme.description: Indicates whether the incoming request uses HTTP or HTTPS.

hostname.description: Indicates the hostname requested. It must be one of the hostnames defined in the property.

uri.description: The URI begins with "/" and can end with "*" for prefix matching.

serverRegions.description: An array of ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 codes indicating the countries of the servers, for example, "US" to represent "United States of America".

clientRegions.description: An array of ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 codes indicating one or more countries which are the source of the client requests, for example, "CN" to represent "China".

clientIpRange.description: Indicates the starting and ending IP addresses of the client requests to match against. They must be in IPv4 or IPv6 format.

action.description: Indicates the action to take in response to a request that matches the conditions of the access control rule.

statusCode.description: Indicates the HTTP status code to respond with. It must be in the range 300-309, 400-409, or 500-509 to indicate a redirection or error.

message.description: If the value of the status field is in the range 300-309, the message field's value will be placed in a Location HTTP header returned to the client. If the status is in the range 400-409 or 500-509, the value will be returned in the response body to the client.

disableCertAutomation.description: By default, CDN Pro takes control of the contents under the /.well-known/{acme-challenge, pki-validation} directories to support certificate auto-renew for properties. If for any reason you need to manage these two directories by yourself on the origin, for example, to implement your own certificate auto-renew mechanism, you can use this configuration option to disable the default behavior by setting its value to true. For more information about our support for certificate auto-renewal, refer to the description of the autoRenew field in the Create a certificate API.

cacheKeyUri.description: This setting controls how the URI of the incoming request is incorporated into the cache key if you use a "rewrite" directive in the property's Edge Logic. The default value, "preRewrite", puts the unmodified URI into the cache key while "postRewrite" uses the modified URI. If your rewrite directive converts multiple different URIs into the same value, using "postRewrite" may result in a higher cache hit ratio.

extraServicePorts.description: This field lists ports other than the default 80 used to handle HTTP requests and ports other than the default 443 used to handle HTTPS requests.

http.description: This is a list of ports other than 80 which are used to handle HTTP requests. The available values can be found in the systemConfigs API's response. If you need another port, please contact our support team.

https.description: This is a list of ports other than 443 which are used to handle HTTPS requests. The available values can be found in the systemConfigs API's response. If you need another port, please contact our support team.

tls0Rtt.description: Enable TLS zero round-trip time, a feature of TLS 1.3 that can improve performance for repeat visits to a site. If enabling it though, be sure your site is not vulnerable to the HTTP replay attack.

enableIpv6Origin.description: Enable use of IPv6 addresses to access the property's origin servers.

followClientIpVersion.description:
When enableIpv6Origin is enabled, this setting controls whether to match the addressing method used by a client if a request to the origin is required to fetch content.
ValueBehavior
autoAttempt to reach the origin server using the same IP addressing as the client, but use the other version as backup if needed.
strictUse only the same addressing method as the client when accessing the origin for content.
offUse both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing to reach the origin, regardless of the IP addressing method used by the client.

enableHttp3.description: Set to true to enable support for HTTP/3. HTTP/3 requires TLS to work, so this field will be ignored unless you specify a certificate in the tlsCertificateId field.

requestBody.description: The body consists of the property configuration you wish to set.

200.description: The response body contains details of the edge hostname.

schema.description: Detailed information about the edge hostname.

apiAccountId.description: Indicates the API account that made the change.

time.description: RFC 3339 format date of the event.

apiRequestId.description: An ID representing the API call that made the change.

hasBeian.description: Indicates whether you have a Beian license for service in China. If you do, content can be served by servers located within mainland China using the ChinaStandard or ChinaPremium server group.

items.title: Edge Hostname Client Zone Rule
items.description:
This object describes how client requests from a zone are handled. A zone is a combination of a geographic region and an ISP. You can create custom rules to balance performance and cost by selecting the server groups used to deliver content.

An additional server group, "nearChina", is available if your domains lack ICP Beian, but you want optimal performance serving Chinese visitors. A client zone rule using nearChina cannot be configured to also deliver to other server groups, though you may create separate client zone rules for those.

If you have an ICP Beian license and want your content to be delivered by servers within China, you can opt to use "ChinaStandard" and "ChinaPremium." 

Please contact our support team if you require nearChina, ChinaStandard, or ChinaPremium.

region.description: This field indicates the region in which the rule applies. Refer to our API to get client regions to get valid region codes. For example, if you wish to create a rule that covers all of Europe, simply specify "eu" as the region. You can indicate specific countries. For example, "na.us" represents the "United States of America", and "eu.fr" represents "France". A special client region “all” can be used to specify that the rule applies to the entire world. If overlapping regions are specified, the more specific one takes precedence. For example, if you specify "as" in one rule and "as.cn" in another, a request from China will follow the rule for "as.cn".

weight.description: When multiple actions are specified for a client zone, the weight is used to adjust the probability of a client zone rule applying to a client request. Consider two rules that apply to "as.cn": {"region":"as.cn", "isp":"all", "action":{"type":"deliver", "by":["standard", "premium", "deluxe"]}}, {"region":"as.cn", "isp":"all", "action":{"type":"redirect", "to":["alternate.cname.com"]}, "weight":10} The probability of "deliver" will be 100/(100+10) or 0.909 while the probability of "redirect" will be 10/(100+10) or 0.091.

action.description: This object describes the action to take for requests matching the rule.

type.description: Defines the action to take for requests to the zone. Options are to deliver using one or more server groups, to reject the request altogether, or to redirect to another domain. If "reject" is specified, the client request will be redirected to a server that always responds with HTTP response code 403 representing "Forbidden". Up to one "reject" action is allowed for each client zone.

by.description:
This field is used if the action is of type "deliver". Specify one or more of the server groups (standard, premium, deluxe, ultra, nearChina, ChinaStandard, ChinaPremium) to control the servers used to deliver content.

"nearChina" is a special server group that can be enabled for you if your domains lack ICP Beian, but you want optimal performance serving Chinese visitors. A client zone rule using nearChina cannot be configured to simultaneously deliver to other server groups, though you may create separate client zone rules to use other server groups.

If you have an ICP Beian license and want your content to be delivered by servers within China, you can opt to use "ChinaStandard" and "ChinaPremium." Please contact our support team if you require nearChina, ChinaStandard, or ChinaPremium.

If an edge hostname is not initially configured to use ChinaStandard or ChinaPremium, you will not be able to modify it later to use these two server groups. Instead, you will need to create a new edge hostname with client zone rules delivering to those server groups.

to.description: This field is used if the action is of type "redirect". It indicates either a single hostname OR one or more IP addresses to redirect to. This is typically an origin server or another CDN provider.

enableIPv6.description: Indicates whether an IPv6 address can be used. This value is used only if the client zone rule's action type is "deliver".

isp.description: Specify the code representing an ISP (Internet Service Provider) if the rule only applies to requests from a particular ISP. Call our API to get a list of supported ISPs. Specify 'all' to indicate all ISPs rather than a particular one. Specify a comma-separated list of up to 10 ISP codes if you want your rule to apply to more than one ISP.

deliverByHttps.title: deliverByHttps
deliverByHttps.description: Support a DNS resource record that advertises HTTPS support (HTTP/2 and HTTP/3). Clients can potentially improve performance and privacy by making use of the information. Example: yourEdgehostname.qtlcdn.com 1800 IN HTTPS 1 . alpn="h2,h3" port=443 The returned DNS record does not reflect the destination a request is redirected to if a client zone rule's action is to redirect.

state.description: Whether to advertise the HTTPS support through a DNS record.

alpn.description:
Indicates the supported protocols.
ValueDescription
h2Supports HTTP/2
h3Supports HTTP/3
h2,h3Supports both HTTP/2 and HTTP3
This field is required if state is set to 'on' and ignored if it is set to 'off'.

port.description: The port supporting HTTPS. This field is ignored if state is set to 'off'.

ttl.description: Number of seconds the DNS record is valid. This field is ignored if state is set to 'off'.

finishTime.description: RFC 3339 format date indicating when the operation completed.

status.description: Status of the operation.

submissionTime.description: RFC 3339 format date indicating when the operation was submitted for processing.

lastUpdateTime.description: RFC 3339 format date indicating when the edge hostname was last updated.

creationTime.description: RFC 3339 format date indicating when the edge hostname was created.

ownerCustomerId.description: Indicates the customer account that owns the edge hostname.

configs.description: Contains settings that can be modified.

description.description: A description of the edge hostname.

hasBeian.description: Indicates whether you have a Beian license for service in China. If you do, content can be served by servers located within mainland China using the ChinaStandard or ChinaPremium server group.

clientZones.description: Rules control how requests from client zones are handled. You can create custom rules to balance performance and cost by selecting the server groups used to deliver content.

items.title: Edge Hostname Client Zone Rule
items.description:
This object describes how client requests from a zone are handled. A zone is a combination of a geographic region and an ISP. You can create custom rules to balance performance and cost by selecting the server groups used to deliver content.

An additional server group, "nearChina", is available if your domains lack ICP Beian, but you want optimal performance serving Chinese visitors. A client zone rule using nearChina cannot be configured to also deliver to other server groups, though you may create separate client zone rules for those.

If you have an ICP Beian license and want your content to be delivered by servers within China, you can opt to use "ChinaStandard" and "ChinaPremium." 

Please contact our support team if you require nearChina, ChinaStandard, or ChinaPremium.

region.description: This field indicates the region in which the rule applies. Refer to our API to get client regions to get valid region codes. For example, if you wish to create a rule that covers all of Europe, simply specify "eu" as the region. You can indicate specific countries. For example, "na.us" represents the "United States of America", and "eu.fr" represents "France". A special client region “all” can be used to specify that the rule applies to the entire world. If overlapping regions are specified, the more specific one takes precedence. If "reject" is specified, the client request will be redirected to a server that always responds with HTTP response code 403 representing "Forbidden". Up to one "reject" action is allowed for each client zone.

If you have an ICP Beian license and want your content to be delivered by servers within China, you can opt to use "ChinaStandard" and "ChinaPremium." Please contact our support team if you require nearChina, ChinaStandard, or ChinaPremium.

If an edge hostname is not initially configured to use ChinaStandard or ChinaPremium, you will not be able to modify it later to use these two server groups. Instead, you will need to create a new edge hostname with client zone rules delivering to those server groups.

to.description: This field is used if the action is of type "redirect". It indicates either a single hostname OR one or more IP addresses to redirect to. This is typically an origin server or another CDN provider.

enableIPv6.description: Indicates whether an IPv6 address can be used. This value is used only if the client zone rule's action type is "deliver".

isp.description: Specify the code representing an ISP (Internet Service Provider) if the rule only applies to requests from a particular ISP. Call our API to get a list of supported ISPs. Specify 'all' to indicate all ISPs rather than a particular one. Specify a comma-separated list of up to 10 ISP codes if you want your rule to apply to more than one ISP.

estimatedBandwidth.description: An estimate of the bandwidth required to serve content using this edge hostname. Units of measurement should be in Tbps, Gbps, Mbps, or kbps. Example: 100Gbps

deliverByHttps.title: deliverByHttps
deliverByHttps.description: Support a DNS resource record that advertises HTTPS support (HTTP/2 and HTTP/3). Clients can potentially improve performance and privacy by making use of the information. Example: yourEdgehostname.qtlcdn.com 1800 IN HTTPS 1 . alpn="h2,h3" port=443 The returned DNS record does not reflect the destination a request is redirected to if a client zone rule's action is to redirect.

Indicates the supported protocols.
ValueDescription
h2Supports HTTP/2

h2,h3Supports both HTTP/2 and HTTP3
This field is required if state is set to 'on' and ignored if it is set to 'off'.

parameters.name: Check-Usage

This safety check is intended to protect against accidentally impacting visitors to your content. You can pass the Check-Usage: no header to bypass this check.

clientZones.description:
Specify rules to control how requests from client zones are handled. You must create at least one rule covering all regions and all ISPs. For example, if you have access to the standard, premium, deluxe, and ultra server groups, you could create this rule allowing several of our server groups to handle requests and achieve the best possible performance: {"region":"all", "isp":"all", "action":{"type":"deliver","by":["standard","premium","deluxe","ultra"]}}.
If potential cost is a greater concern, you can choose different server groups to balance your cost and performance requirements.

For example, if you specify "as" in one rule and "as.cn" in another, a request from China will follow the rule for "as.cn".

weight.description: When multiple actions are specified for a client zone, the weight is used to adjust the probability of a client zone rule applying to a client request. Consider two rules that apply to "as.cn": {"region":"as.cn", "isp":"all", "action":{"type":"deliver", "by":["standard", "premium", "deluxe"]}}, {"region":"as.cn", "isp":"all", "action":{"type":"redirect", "to":["alternate.cname.com"]}, "weight":10} The probability of "deliver" will be 100/(100+10) or 0.909 while the probability of "redirect" will be 10/(100+10) or 0.091.

action.description: This object describes the action to take for requests matching the rule.

type.description: Defines the action to take for requests to the zone. Options are to deliver using one or more server groups, to reject the request altogether, or to redirect to another domain. If "reject" is specified, the client request will be redirected to a server that always responds with HTTP response code 403 representing "Forbidden". Up to one "reject" action is allowed for each client zone.

by.description:
This field is used if the action is of type "deliver". Specify one or more of the server groups (standard, premium, deluxe, ultra, nearChina, ChinaStandard, ChinaPremium) to control the servers used to deliver content.

"nearChina" is a special server group that can be enabled for you if your domains lack ICP Beian, but you want optimal performance serving Chinese visitors. A client zone rule using nearChina cannot be configured to simultaneously deliver to other server groups, though you may create separate client zone rules to use other server groups.

If you have an ICP Beian license and want your content to be delivered by servers within China, you can opt to use "ChinaStandard" and "ChinaPremium." Please contact our support team if you require nearChina, ChinaStandard, or ChinaPremium.

If an edge hostname is not initially configured to use ChinaStandard or ChinaPremium, you will not be able to modify it later to use these two server groups. Instead, you will need to create a new edge hostname with client zone rules delivering to those server groups.

to.description: This field is used if the action is of type "redirect". It indicates either a single hostname OR one or more IP addresses to redirect to. This is typically an origin server or another CDN provider.

enableIPv6.description: Indicates whether an IPv6 address can be used. This value is used only if the client zone rule's action type is "deliver".

isp.description: Specify the code representing an ISP (Internet Service Provider) if the rule only applies to requests from a particular ISP. Call our API to get a list of supported ISPs. Specify 'all' to indicate all ISPs rather than a particular one. Specify a comma-separated list of up to 10 ISP codes if you want your rule to apply to more than one ISP.

estimatedBandwidth.description: An estimate of the bandwidth required to serve content using this edge hostname. Units of measurement should be in Tbps, Gbps, Mbps, or kbps. Example: 100Gbps

deliverByHttps.title: deliverByHttps
deliverByHttps.description: Support a DNS resource record that advertises HTTPS support (HTTP/2 and HTTP/3). Clients can potentially improve performance and privacy by making use of the information. Example: yourEdgehostname.qtlcdn.com 1800 IN HTTPS 1 . alpn="h2,h3" port=443 The returned DNS record does not reflect the destination a request is redirected to if a client zone rule's action is to redirect.

state.description: Whether to advertise the HTTPS support through a DNS record.

alpn.description:
Indicates the supported protocols.
ValueDescription
h2Supports HTTP/2
h3Supports HTTP/3
h2,h3Supports both HTTP/2 and HTTP3
This field is required if state is set to 'on' and ignored if it is set to 'off'.

port.description: The port supporting HTTPS. This field is ignored if state is set to 'off'.

ttl.description: Number of seconds the DNS record is valid. This field is ignored if state is set to 'off'.

requestBody.description: The request body fully describes the edge hostname. Please include all fields even if you are not changing their values.

parameters.name: On-Behalf-Of
parameters.description: If you are a reseller, you can use this header to specify the ID of a child customer.

204.description: The edge hostname was successfully updated.

400.description: The request was invalid. Refer to the response body for details.

value.message: Invalid client region 'abc'.
Invalid ISP 'abcdef'.
There must be a client zone rule that covers all regions and ISPs.
The edge hostname is being deployed and cannot be updated or deleted now.
The nearChina server group cannot be used for regions outside mainland China.
The field 'to' must not contain duplicate IP addresses.
The field 'to' supports a maximum of 15 IP addresses.
The alpn for deliverByHttps must be “h2”, “h3” or “h2,h3”.
The port for deliverByHttps must be an integer in [80,65535].

404.description: The edge hostname could not be found. Refer to the response body for details.

value.message: The specified edge hostname does not exist or the caller doesn't have access to this resource.

409.description: The edgeHostname field cannot be changed because it may cause a service interruption.

value.message: The edge hostname cannot be changed.

patch.description: This API allows you to update an edge hostname by sending only the fields that are changing.

description.description: A description of the edge hostname.

clientZones.description:
Specify rules to control how requests from client zones are handled. You must create at least one rule covering all regions and all ISPs. For example, if you have access to the standard, premium, deluxe, and ultra server groups, you could create this rule allowing several of our server groups to handle requests and achieve the best possible performance: {"region":"all", "isp":"all", "action":{"type":"deliver","by":["standard","premium","deluxe","ultra"]}}.
If potential cost is a greater concern, you can choose different server groups to balance your cost and performance requirements.

items.title: Edge Hostname Client Zone Rule
items.description:
This object describes how client requests from a zone are handled. A zone is a combination of a geographic region and an ISP. You can create custom rules to balance performance and cost by selecting the server groups used to deliver content.

An additional server group, "nearChina", is available if your domains lack ICP Beian, but you want optimal performance serving Chinese visitors. A client zone rule using nearChina cannot be configured to also deliver to other server groups, though you may create separate client zone rules for those.

If you have an ICP Beian license and want your content to be delivered by servers within China, you can opt to use "ChinaStandard" and "ChinaPremium." 

Please contact our support team if you require nearChina, ChinaStandard, or ChinaPremium.

region.description: This field indicates the region in which the rule applies. Refer to our API to get client regions to get valid region codes. For example, if you wish to create a rule that covers all of Europe, simply specify "eu" as the region. You can indicate specific countries. For example, "na.us" represents the "United States of America", and "eu.fr" represents "France". A special client region “all” can be used to specify that the rule applies to the entire world. If overlapping regions are specified, the more specific one takes precedence. For example, if you specify "as" in one rule and "as.cn" in another, a request from China will follow the rule for "as.cn".

weight.description: When multiple actions are specified for a client zone, the weight is used to adjust the probability of a client zone rule applying to a client request. Consider two rules that apply to "as.cn": {"region":"as.cn", "isp":"all", "action":{"type":"deliver", "by":["standard", "premium", "deluxe"]}}, {"region":"as.cn", "isp":"all", "action":{"type":"redirect", "to":["alternate.cname.com"]}, "weight":10} The probability of "deliver" will be 100/(100+10) or 0.909 while the probability of "redirect" will be 10/(100+10) or 0.091.

action.description: This object describes the action to take for requests matching the rule.

type.description: Defines the action to take for requests to the zone. Options are to deliver using one or more server groups, to reject the request altogether, or to redirect to another domain. If "reject" is specified, the client request will be redirected to a server that always responds with HTTP response code 403 representing "Forbidden". Up to one "reject" action is allowed for each client zone.

by.description:
This field is used if the action is of type "deliver". Specify one or more of the server groups (standard, premium, deluxe, ultra, nearChina, ChinaStandard, ChinaPremium) to control the servers used to deliver content.

"nearChina" is a special server group that can be enabled for you if your domains lack ICP Beian, but you want optimal performance serving Chinese visitors. A client zone rule using nearChina cannot be configured to simultaneously deliver to other server groups, though you may create separate client zone rules to use other server groups.

If you have an ICP Beian license and want your content to be delivered by servers within China, you can opt to use "ChinaStandard" and "ChinaPremium." Please contact our support team if you require nearChina, ChinaStandard, or ChinaPremium.

If an edge hostname is not initially configured to use ChinaStandard or ChinaPremium, you will not be able to modify it later to use these two server groups. Instead, you will need to create a new edge hostname with client zone rules delivering to those server groups.

to.description: This field is used if the action is of type "redirect". It indicates either a single hostname OR one or more IP addresses to redirect to. This is typically an origin server or another CDN provider.

enableIPv6.description: Indicates whether an IPv6 address can be used. This value is used only if the client zone rule's action type is "deliver".

isp.description: Specify the code representing an ISP (Internet Service Provider) if the rule only applies to requests from a particular ISP. Call our API to get a list of supported ISPs. Specify 'all' to indicate all ISPs rather than a particular one. Specify a comma-separated list of up to 10 ISP codes if you want your rule to apply to more than one ISP.

estimatedBandwidth.description: An estimate of the bandwidth required to serve content using this edge hostname. Units of measurement should be in Tbps, Gbps, Mbps, or kbps. Example: 100Gbps

deliverByHttps.title: deliverByHttps
deliverByHttps.description: Support a DNS resource record that advertises HTTPS support (HTTP/2 and HTTP/3). Clients can potentially improve performance and privacy by making use of the information. Example: yourEdgehostname.qtlcdn.com 1800 IN HTTPS 1 . alpn="h2,h3" port=443 The returned DNS record does not reflect the destination a request is redirected to if a client zone rule's action is to redirect.

state.description: Whether to advertise the HTTPS support through a DNS record.

alpn.description:
Indicates the supported protocols.
ValueDescription
h2Supports HTTP/2
h3Supports HTTP/3
h2,h3Supports both HTTP/2 and HTTP3
This field is required if state is set to 'on' and ignored if it is set to 'off'.

port.description: The port supporting HTTPS. This field is ignored if state is set to 'off'.

ttl.description: Number of seconds the DNS record is valid. This field is ignored if state is set to 'off'.

value.description: This is a new edge hostname for use with our property.

requestBody.description: The request body contains the fields you wish to modify.

parameters.name: On-Behalf-Of
parameters.description: If you are a reseller, you can use this header to specify the ID of a child customer.

get.description: Get a list of all property versions. A summary of each version including its status and associated hostnames is returned.

200.description: Returns a list of property versions.

propertyVersions.description: A summary of each version of the property.

items.description: Describe a particular property version.

description.description: A description of the property version.

creationTime.description: RFC 3339 format date indicating when the property version was created. Example: 2016-12-28T23:10:42Z

hostnames.description: Hostnames associated with the property.

frozen.description: Indicates whether the property version is frozen or can still be updated. A property version is frozen once it has been deployed.

lastUpdateTime.description: RFC 3339 format date indicating when the property version was last updated. Example: 2016-12-28T23:10:42Z

lastValidationStatus.description: Indicates the status of the most recent validation of the property version.

count.description: Indicates the number of versions of the property.

400.description: Invalid request. Refer to the response body for details.

value.message: The value of limit should be between 1 and 200, inclusive.
The offset must be a valid non-negative integer.
The valid sort order values are asc and desc.
The valid sort by values for this endpoint are 'version', 'lastUpdateTime'.

404.description: The property could not be found.

value.message: The specified property ID does not exist.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The search parameter is used to match against the description field to filter the results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Controls the number of versions to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Returns property versions beginning with this index instead of the default first one.

parameters.name: On-Behalf-Of
parameters.description: If you are a reseller, you can use this header to specify the ID of a child customer.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Returns results in sorted order.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Order of property versions to return, either ascending, represented by 'asc', or descending, represented by 'desc' .

201.description: A new property version was successfully created. The Location HTTP header indicates the version number. Example: Location: http://ngapi.cdnetworks.com/cdn/properties/e0d1819863b856c42635ae17/versions/8

Warning.description: This header will appear if the property refers to a certificate that is expired or does not support the property's hostname. Call Get a property version API for details.

400.description: The request was invalid. Refer to the response body for details.

value.message: The origin hostHeader 'invalid' is invalid. It must be a valid hostname or a variable name ($ + a string consists of lower case a-z and '_' with length 3-60).
At least one of the hostnames is equal to an origin's server name.
The https service port 1234 is not supported.
The directive 'origin_fast_route' is not enabled for your account. Please contact our support team if you require it.
An invalid directive 'ORIGIN_set_header' was found in your Edge Logic. Please refer to the API documentation for a list of supported directives.
Invalid hostname(s): "ghjhkj参考.domain.com".
Invalid origin server 'testdomain.info:'. The origin server format is {hostname or IP address}:{http port},{https port} [weight=1-100] [backup].
A shield is acceptable only when "directConnection" is set to "noDirect".

403.description: The request was forbidden. Please refer to the response body for details.

value.message: You have created the maximum number of versions allowed in a property. We recommend you create a new property and copy the configuration. Alternately, you may contact our support team to delete old versions from the property.

404.description: The property could not be found.
